page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: {Farming}is mixed; arable: Masham, Romney and Kent sheep, dairy, Beef cattle, pigs and fruit with one market-garden.{'Pick Your Own'}is a popular form of fruit-selling on small farms. A few farmers use organic fertilisers, most use inorganic. Specialized machinery is widely owned, even on small farms. There are a few small co-operatives run by managers, most are owner-farmed and under fifty hectares.{The soil is heavy,}needing effective drainage. One farmer has a private museum of historical farming implements and WW2 tanks.Another keeps a wood as a Conservation area. Only one farmer uses{aerial crop spraying, which can damage wildlife. Most fields are under 5ha and are bounded by traditional hedges which reduces wind damage, soil erosion and provided wildlife habitats.
